required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Plasmid DNA Therapeutic Vaccine(GX-188E)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multi-center, Phase 2 Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and the Safety of GX-188E, a DNA-based Therapeutic Vaccine, Administered Intramuscularly by Electroporation(EP) in HPV Type 16 and/or 18 Positive Patients With Biopsy-proven Cervical Intraepithelial Neoplasia Grade 2(CIN2), Grade 2/3 (CIN2/3), Grade 3(CIN3)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to access the efficacy and safety of GX-188E according the protocol in patients with Cervical Intraepithelial Neoplasia 2, 2/3 or 3 (CIN3)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with histopathological regression of cervical lesions to CIN1 or less
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with cervical lesions regress to CIN1 or less at the 36 week visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Clearance of HPV 16 or 18 in combination with histopathological regression of cervical lesions to CIN1 or less
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with clearance of HPV 16 or 18 in combination with histopathological regression of cervical lesions to CIN1 or less at the 36 week visit

intervention.description: 1mg of GX-188E administered IM using EP device at day 0, week 4 and week 12.
0.5mL of Placebo administered IM using EP device at day 0, week 4 and week 12.
